fields.label: Post Acquisition Adjustment
fields.description: Indicator to whether to perform Acquisition Adjustment or Post Acquisition Adjustment. Enter 0 for Acquisition Adjustment or 1 for Post Acquisition Adjustment.

metadata.description: Indicator to whether to perform Acquisition Adjustment or Post Acquisition Adjustment. Enter 0 for Acquisition Adjustment or 1 for Post Acquisition Adjustment.

fields.label: Transaction Effective Date
fields.description: Date of cost adjustment (transaction effective date of the cost adjustment). This value is required if Post Acquisition Adjustment is 1.

metadata.description: Date of cost adjustment (transaction effective date of the cost adjustment). This value is required if Post Acquisition Adjustment is 1.

fields.label: Adjustment Amount
fields.description: Adjustment amount. Can be positive or negative. Cannot bring total cost down to zero or negative

metadata.description: Adjustment amount. Can be positive or negative. Cannot bring total cost down to zero or negative

fields.label: Adjustment Quantity
fields.description: Adjustment quantity can be positive or negative. You cannot bring total approved quantity to zero. You cannot bring total approved quantity to be less than consumed quantity. Quantity adjustments apply to all asset books.

metadata.description: Adjustment quantity can be positive or negative. You cannot bring total approved quantity to zero. You cannot bring total approved quantity to be less than consumed quantity. Quantity adjustments apply to all asset books.

fields.label: Adjustment Residual Value
fields.description: Adjustment residual value. Can be positive or negative but cannot bring down total residual to below 0.

metadata.description: Adjustment residual value. Can be positive or negative but cannot bring down total residual to below 0.

fields.label: Accounting Date

fields.label: Spend Category Reference ID
fields.description:
-To be consistent with your asset book rules configured in the tenant for the consistency between your historical and new assets.
-This is the reference id value of the spend category. A spend category is a classification of items and services that drive the accounting. All expense items are associated with a Spend Category and sales items are associated with a Revenue Category. If a value is provided for sales item, revenue category will default so it is recommended to provide a value for either sales item or revenue category but not both. It is required if sales item is blank.

metadata.description:
-To be consistent with your asset book rules configured in the tenant for the consistency between your historical and new assets.
-This is the reference id value of the spend category. A spend category is a classification of items and services that drive the accounting. All expense items are associated with a Spend Category and sales items are associated with a Revenue Category. If a value is provided for sales item, revenue category will default so it is recommended to provide a value for either sales item or revenue category but not both. It is required if sales item is blank.

fields.label: Accounting Treatment Reference ID
fields.description: This is the reference id value to an existing accounting treatment. Workday supplies the accounting treatments Expense, Depreciable Capital and Non-Depreciable Capital. If you don't enter a value, Workday will default accounting treatment from the Business Asset Accounting Rules based on the values from Company, Spend Category and Cost of asset.

metadata.description: This is the reference id value to an existing accounting treatment. Workday supplies the accounting treatments Expense, Depreciable Capital and Non-Depreciable Capital. If you don't enter a value, Workday will default accounting treatment from the Business Asset Accounting Rules based on the values from Company, Spend Category and Cost of asset.

fields.label: Depreciation Profile Override Reference ID
fields.description:
-Initial depreciation period for the asset. Important for the asset information, but no impact on the asset accounting values for the historical assets.
-Reference to an existing depreciation profile for this depreciation schedule. This value may be overridden for the primary book.

metadata.description:
-Initial depreciation period for the asset. Important for the asset information, but no impact on the asset accounting values for the historical assets.
-Reference to an existing depreciation profile for this depreciation schedule. This value may be overridden for the primary book.

fields.label: Depreciation Method Override Reference ID
fields.description: Reference to an existing Depreciation Method. Depreciation Methods are provided by Workday and include STRAIGHT_LINE, DECLINING_BALANCE_SW_SL, and SUM_OF_YEARS_DIGITS. This field defaults from the spend category but can be entered.

metadata.description: Reference to an existing Depreciation Method. Depreciation Methods are provided by Workday and include STRAIGHT_LINE, DECLINING_BALANCE_SW_SL, and SUM_OF_YEARS_DIGITS. This field defaults from the spend category but can be entered.

fields.label: Depreciation Percent Override
fields.description: Depreciation percent for Declining Balance with Switch to Straight Line (DECLINING_BALANCE_SW_SL) method. Enter 200 for Double Declining. This field defaults from the spend category depreciation profile but can be entered.

metadata.description: Depreciation percent for Declining Balance with Switch to Straight Line (DECLINING_BALANCE_SW_SL) method. Enter 200 for Double Declining. This field defaults from the spend category depreciation profile but can be entered.

fields.label: Useful Life in Periods Override
fields.description: Numeric value representing the useful life (in periods) for the business asset. This field defaults from Spend Category Depreciation Profile but can be entered

metadata.description: Numeric value representing the useful life (in periods) for the business asset. This field defaults from Spend Category Depreciation Profile but can be entered

fields.label: Depreciation Threshold Override
fields.description: Depreciation Threshold. Enter only if method is declining balance.

metadata.description: Depreciation Threshold. Enter only if method is declining balance.

fields.label: Depreciation Start Date
fields.description:
-Should be always project go-live date.
-For converted assets, the depreciation start date represents the date that depreciation starts in Workday. For converted assets with historical accumulated depreciation, the depreciation start date should be 1 day greater than the date up to which the historical accumulated depreciation is calculated. The date cannot be prior to the acquisition date. For converted assets with no historical accumulated depreciation, leave the depreciation start date blank so that Workday can determine the correct date.

metadata.description:
-Should be always project go-live date.
-For converted assets, the depreciation start date represents the date that depreciation starts in Workday. For converted assets with historical accumulated depreciation, the depreciation start date should be 1 day greater than the date up to which the historical accumulated depreciation is calculated. The date cannot be prior to the acquisition date. For converted assets with no historical accumulated depreciation, leave the depreciation start date blank so that Workday can determine the correct date.

fields.label: Remaining Depreciation Periods
fields.description:
-In numbers, including decimals. Example: 1.5 means 1 month and 15 days to be depreciated in WD after the date of the go-live.
-Numeric value for remaining depreciation periods if entering accumulated depreciation from a prior system.

metadata.description:
-In numbers, including decimals. Example: 1.5 means 1 month and 15 days to be depreciated in WD after the date of the go-live.
-Numeric value for remaining depreciation periods if entering accumulated depreciation from a prior system.

fields.label: Accumulated Depreciation
fields.description:
-Balance sheet accumulated value as of the go-live date, this subledger value should match to the G/L opening balance for the go-live date which is loaded separately.
-Accumulated Depreciation

metadata.description:
-Balance sheet accumulated value as of the go-live date, this subledger value should match to the G/L opening balance for the go-live date which is loaded separately.
-Accumulated Depreciation

fields.label: Year To Date Depreciation
fields.description:
-P&L current year YTD depreciation expense total.
-Year To Date depreciation as of the Depreciation Start Date. Enter only if method is declining balance or sum of years digits.

metadata.description:
-P&L current year YTD depreciation expense total.
-Year To Date depreciation as of the Depreciation Start Date. Enter only if method is declining balance or sum of years digits.

fields.label: Component Lifecycles are Discrete
fields.description: This attribute is used to identify the type of Composite Asset. When it is checked, life cycle events happen for each Component independently. When it is unchecked, life cycle events happen on the Composite asset only.

metadata.description: This attribute is used to identify the type of Composite Asset. When it is checked, life cycle events happen for each Component independently. When it is unchecked, life cycle events happen on the Composite asset only.

name: Update Asset Book Configuration
description: {"Population Scope / Selection Criteria": null, "Notes": null, "PRIMARY TABLE": null, "SECONDARY TABLES": null, "JOIN LOGIC": null, "WHERE LOGIC": null, "REFERENCE TYPES": null, "MANUAL CODE TO RUN AFTER": null, "MANUAL CODE TO RUN PRIOR": null, "DECLARED VALUES": "@conversionDate = ''", "WEB SERVICE": "Update_Asset_Book_Configuration", "STANDARD SP": null, "API VERSION": null}

fields.label: Add Only
fields.description: Add Only Flag. Indicates that the service is an add only, not an update.

metadata.description: Add Only Flag. Indicates that the service is an add only, not an update.

fields.label: Asset ID
fields.description: The primary ID of the asset of this asset depreciation schedule. The value of this field and the asset book reference represent a unique ID that can be used to identify this asset depreciation schedule instance

metadata.description: The primary ID of the asset of this asset depreciation schedule. The value of this field and the asset book reference represent a unique ID that can be used to identify this asset depreciation schedule instance

fields.label: Asset Book Reference ID
fields.description: This is the reference id value to an asset book used by the asset company. A value is required for every asset depreciation schedule. The value of this book cannot be the primary book for the asset company.

metadata.description: This is the reference id value to an asset book used by the asset company. A value is required for every asset depreciation schedule. The value of this book cannot be the primary book for the asset company.

fields.label: Accounting Treatment Reference ID
fields.description: This is the reference id value to an existing accounting treatment. Workday supplies the accounting treatments Expense, Depreciable Capital and Non-Depreciable Capital. It is required for every asset depreciation schedule.

metadata.description: This is the reference id value to an existing accounting treatment. Workday supplies the accounting treatments Expense, Depreciable Capital and Non-Depreciable Capital. It is required for every asset depreciation schedule.

fields.label: Depreciation Profile Reference ID
fields.description: Reference to depreciation profile used by this asset depreciation schedule. It is required of the accounting treatment is depreciable capital.

metadata.description: Reference to depreciation profile used by this asset depreciation schedule. It is required of the accounting treatment is depreciable capital.

fields.label: Depreciation Convention Reference ID
fields.description: Reference to depreciation convention used by this asset depreciation schedule. It is required if the accounting treatment is depreciable capital. In order to assign 'Half-Year' as the depreciation convention, the company asset book must use a fiscal schedule with an even number of fiscal periods per fiscal year. In order to assign 'Mid-Quarter' as the depreciation convention, the company asset book must use a fiscal schedule where number of fiscal periods per fiscal year is divisible by 4.

metadata.description: Reference to depreciation convention used by this asset depreciation schedule. It is required if the accounting treatment is depreciable capital. In order to assign 'Half-Year' as the depreciation convention, the company asset book must use a fiscal schedule with an even number of fiscal periods per fiscal year. In order to assign 'Mid-Quarter' as the depreciation convention, the company asset book must use a fiscal schedule where number of fiscal periods per fiscal year is divisible by 4.

fields.label: Depreciation Method Reference ID
fields.description: Reference to depreciation method used by this asset depreciation schedule. It is required if the accounting treatment is depreciable capital

metadata.description: Reference to depreciation method used by this asset depreciation schedule. It is required if the accounting treatment is depreciable capital

fields.label: Depreciation Percent
fields.description: Numeric value representing the depreciation percent for Declining Balance with Switch to Straight Line method. It is required when the depreciation method is declining balance. It left blank, it will be defaulted from the depreciation profile.

metadata.description: Numeric value representing the depreciation percent for Declining Balance with Switch to Straight Line method. It is required when the depreciation method is declining balance. It left blank, it will be defaulted from the depreciation profile.

fields.label: Useful Life Periods
fields.description: Numeric value representing the useful life (in periods) for the asset depreciation schedule. It is required if the accounting treatment is depreciable capital. If left blank it will be defaulted from the depreciation profile.

metadata.description: Numeric value representing the useful life (in periods) for the asset depreciation schedule. It is required if the accounting treatment is depreciable capital. If left blank it will be defaulted from the depreciation profile.

fields.label: Depreciation Threshold
fields.description: Depreciation Threshold. Enter only if method is declining balance.

metadata.description: Depreciation Threshold. Enter only if method is declining balance.

fields.label: Contract Start Date
fields.description: Workday uses these dates to update External Contract Start and End date if you manually register the asset but updates the In service Start and End date for all other sources.

metadata.description: Workday uses these dates to update External Contract Start and End date if you manually register the asset but updates the In service Start and End date for all other sources.

fields.label: Contract End Date
fields.description: Workday uses these dates to update External Contract Start and End date if you manually register the asset but updates the In service Start and End date for all other sources.

metadata.description: Workday uses these dates to update External Contract Start and End date if you manually register the asset but updates the In service Start and End date for all other sources.

fields.label: Date Placed in Service
fields.description: Date value representing the date this asset depreciation schedule is placed in service. It is required if the depreciation schedule has historical information. It cannot be after depreciation start date and prior to the asset acquisition date.

metadata.description: Date value representing the date this asset depreciation schedule is placed in service. It is required if the depreciation schedule has historical information. It cannot be after depreciation start date and prior to the asset acquisition date.

fields.label: Bonus Depreciation Percent
fields.description: Numeric value representing bonus depreciation percent for this asset depreciation schedule. Value cannot be more than 100.

metadata.description: Numeric value representing bonus depreciation percent for this asset depreciation schedule. Value cannot be more than 100.

fields.label: Max Bonus Depreciable Basis
fields.description: Numeric value representing the maximum bonus depreciation basis. Workday would use the lesser of this field and asset cost that is applicable to bonus depreciation to calculated the bonus amount.

metadata.description: Numeric value representing the maximum bonus depreciation basis. Workday would use the lesser of this field and asset cost that is applicable to bonus depreciation to calculated the bonus amount.

fields.label: Depreciation Start Date
fields.description: For converted assets, the depreciation start date represents the date that depreciation starts in Workday. For converted assets with historical accumulated depreciation, the depreciation start date should be 1 day greater than the date up to which the historical accumulated depreciation is calculated. The date cannot be prior to the acquisition date. For converted assets with no historical accumulated depreciation, leave the depreciation start date blank so that Workday can determine the correct date.

metadata.description: For converted assets, the depreciation start date represents the date that depreciation starts in Workday. For converted assets with historical accumulated depreciation, the depreciation start date should be 1 day greater than the date up to which the historical accumulated depreciation is calculated. The date cannot be prior to the acquisition date. For converted assets with no historical accumulated depreciation, leave the depreciation start date blank so that Workday can determine the correct date.

fields.label: Remaining Depreciation Periods
fields.description: Numeric value for remaining depreciation periods if entering accumulated depreciation from a prior system and depreciation start date. Workday will generate depreciation entries for this schedule for the number of remaining periods.

metadata.description: Numeric value for remaining depreciation periods if entering accumulated depreciation from a prior system and depreciation start date. Workday will generate depreciation entries for this schedule for the number of remaining periods.

fields.label: Original Acquisition Cost
fields.description: The Unit Cost of Asset for the specified Book

metadata.description: The Unit Cost of Asset for the specified Book

fields.label: Total Asset Cost
fields.description: This field is for display only, any values updated will be ignored.

metadata.description: This field is for display only, any values updated will be ignored.

fields.label: Residual Value
fields.description: Residual or salvage value for the specified Book

metadata.description: Residual or salvage value for the specified Book

fields.label: Fair Market Value
fields.description: Fair Market Value for the specified book

metadata.description: Fair Market Value for the specified book

fields.label: Accumulated Depreciation
fields.description: Numeric value representing historical accumulated depreciation as of a day prior to depreciation start date. This value cannot be greater than historical cost minus historical residual value. Workday uses this accumulated depreciation value to determine depreciable cost basis to generate the depreciation schedule for remaining useful life starting from depreciation start date.

metadata.description: Numeric value representing historical accumulated depreciation as of a day prior to depreciation start date. This value cannot be greater than historical cost minus historical residual value. Workday uses this accumulated depreciation value to determine depreciable cost basis to generate the depreciation schedule for remaining useful life starting from depreciation start date.

fields.label: Year to Date Depreciation
fields.description: Numeric value representing year-to-date depreciation as of a day period to depreciation start date. This field is required if the asset depreciation schedule has historical information and the depreciation method is either declining balance or sum of years digits. The value of this field cannot be greater than historical accumulated depreciation.

metadata.description: Numeric value representing year-to-date depreciation as of a day period to depreciation start date. This field is required if the asset depreciation schedule has historical information and the depreciation method is either declining balance or sum of years digits. The value of this field cannot be greater than historical accumulated depreciation.

fields.label: Historical Bonus Depreciation
fields.description: Numeric value representing historical bonus depreciation amount. This field is required if the depreciation schedule has historical information and bonus depreciation percent is populated, else it should be left empty. The value of this field cannot be greater than accumulated depreciation.

metadata.description: Numeric value representing historical bonus depreciation amount. This field is required if the depreciation schedule has historical information and bonus depreciation percent is populated, else it should be left empty. The value of this field cannot be greater than accumulated depreciation.

fields.label: Asset Book Configuration Status Reference ID
fields.description: A reference to the status of the asset book configuration

metadata.description: A reference to the status of the asset book configuration

fields.label: Historical Cost Balance
fields.description: A numeric value that represents historical cost balance for depreciation schedule. Historical cost are those transactions with transaction effective date prior to depreciation start date.

metadata.description: A numeric value that represents historical cost balance for depreciation schedule. Historical cost are those transactions with transaction effective date prior to depreciation start date.

metadata.description: A reference to the Company this asset belongs to.
